description: Logically valid argument from false premise (all birds can fly is false)

issues.description: Premise 'All birds can fly' is factually false. Many birds (penguins, ostriches, kiwis, emus) cannot fly.

expected_verifier_output.reasoning: While the argument is logically valid (the conclusion follows from the premises via syllogistic reasoning), it is unsound because Premise 1 is factually false. Not all birds can fly - penguins, ostriches, kiwis, emus, and several other bird species are flightless. The argument demonstrates valid deductive form but reaches a false conclusion due to a false premise.

notes: This example tests detection of unsound arguments due to false premises. The logical structure is valid (it's a valid syllogism), but the argument is unsound because the first premise is false. This is a classic example used in logic education to distinguish validity from soundness.
